snippet: In “Imagining O,” Richard Schechner meshes Shakespeare with “Story of O,” depicting women as strong and defiant.
abstract: Laura Collins-Hughes reviews East Coast Artists production of play Imagining O, conceived and directed by Richard Schechner, at the Alexander Kasser Theater at Montclair State University as part of its Peak Performances series.
lead_paragraph: In “Imagining O,” Richard Schechner meshes Shakespeare with “Story of O,” depicting women as strong and defiant.

headline.seo: Richard Schechner’s ‘Imagining O’ at Montclair State
headline.main: Ophelia and Friends, Dominated but in Control
headline.print_headline: Ophelia and Friends, Dominated but in Control
